newsitem.title: UK: IPE gas oil ends firm, Brent dips on Iraq jitters.
newsitem.headline: IPE gas oil ends firm, Brent dips on Iraq jitters.

text.p: IPE gas oil futures closed firm on Thursday, supported by good buying and rallies on Brent and NYMEX futures, brokers said.
September gas oil closed up $3.00 at $191.00 a tonne, just off a session high of $191.50. The Sep/Oct backwardation narrowed 25 cents with the October contract closing at $189.00.

Brent futures dipped shortly after the gas oil close on perceptions that Iraqi oil was moving closer to international markets. But a U.N. official said on Thursday that the Iraqi export deal would not be in force for at least ten days. Oct Brent stood 41 cents up at $20.61 a barrel at 1718 GMT.
The contract tested a high of $20.80 a barrel earlier in the session in a technically-led rally on both sides of the Atlantic.
"It's purely on technicals," said one broker. "We were strong this morning and NYMEX's performance has just confirmed the move."
The market eased back briefly and then began to retrace gains amid confusion over the timing of Iraqi oil sales.
